page.title: 08DUNTON BASSETT CHURCH
page.content: {ALL SAINTS CHURCH - DUNTON BASSETT The first church was built in the 13th century. Lady Geve Ridel gave the church and land to the Benedictine Monks at Sutton Coldfield. There are 3 stone carved heads of Lady Ridel inside the church. The Visitors' Book dates from 1931. The furthest visitor came from Arisona, USA. The 14th century bench seats are recorded in Coxs' "English Church Furniture". The font is 15th century, together with the oak roof. Currently there is much restoration needed to the floor, spire and organ, costing more than Â£27,000. The memorials inside the church are for vicars, except for Thomas Stokes, J.P. 1784-1867, who gave the land for the school in 1848. In the graveyard the oldest stone was for John Phillips who died in 1754. {By Chris, Grant, Joanne, Craig, Duncan
